I know every family has their own cherished holiday traditions. Now each year we put up a tree, I think about Jordan in his Christmas pajamas and Freckles in his reindeer antlers ‚Äì and those memories never fail to cheer me up.

So, the tradition we settled on was putting out the wrapped presents on Christmas Eve, then covering them with a bunch of old, white towels. Every Christmas morning without fail, I‚Äôd come downstairs at 6 AM to yellow towels covering the presents under the tree. Merry Christmas!

After the tree was up and decorated, Jordan loved seeing his presents early and under the tree (the ones that weren‚Äôt from Santa) so he could puzzle out if any were from his list. Problem was that if we left presents out for too long, Freckles would go and ‚Äúdecorate‚Äù them too.

Because it was usually just the two of us, he‚Äôd have to hold the stand while I tried to wrestle the tree into place. And then of course, Freckles the dog would decorate the tree in his own special way‚Ä¶ by peeing on it. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/FHe_t3bWQAQrCAP.jpg

Jordan always loved Christmas as a child, even as he got older.

Most years, it was just the two of us and our dog Freckles celebrating together. As a little kid, Jordan was so excited every year to go get a fresh tree so we could kick off Christmas at our house.

Friends,

The holidays can be bittersweet in these times. Since Jordan‚Äôs murder, its always been challenging because I lost the person I shared precious Christmas memories and traditions with. So, I hope this story brightens your day because it's one that always cheers me up. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/FHe_kpIXsAsA6Go.jpg
